history.text: The movie appears to have a really good cast.
yes, it also has good ratings from critics!
I think in someway everyone that went to high school would find that they relate to one or more characters.
I did not know that it is based on a non-fiction self-help book. Did you?
I did not. I would have never guessed it was based on non-fiction.
I also did not realize it was created in 2004!

Yes it's 14 years old this year! It is such an iconic teen
 film of the 2000s
I did not realize that Tina Fey was a screenwriter. For this film or in general.
I didnt know it was directed by a man!
I didn't either.
Are you familiar with the director?
I am not. Are you?
Not at all.
Do you like this movie?

I do like this movie!
\
Can you imagine moving from Africa to Illinois?!
That would be quite a culture shock!
also going from being home-schooled to high school!
As well as homeschooling straight into the public school sustem
Oh, same thought!
Hahaha yeah! Double culture shock for Cady
Although it is based on a nonfiction book it seems to greatly exaggerate a lot of things! dont you think?
To know what to do at that age is hard enough, add that kind of shock...
Yes, I do think it exaggerates a lot.
Perhaps it doesn't, but I was never exposed to the amount of bullying and drama.
I was not exposed to it either. And the cliques seem unrealistic in the sense that they only hang out with each other.
The amount of activity the principal is involved in seems to be exagerated as well
It seems that everything Cady did backfired on her.
I'm not sure that the "outcast" fully recovers like she does in this movie. Perhaps the movie is very loosely based on the book.
Yes, it seems unlikely that everyone went from hating Cady to forgiving her in a matter of minutes. And that after her speech the Plastics no longer terrorize the other students.
And to be voted Queen. It does make for a great ending.
yes! movies do not have to be realistic to be great!
I'm not sure that it would have been a hit if it had ended with the plastics trumpeting haha.
Yep the "good" had to win! And like most high school movie it ends with the moral of "be yourself"
I do like that message!
It is especially important for teenagers and children to learn from it!
I agree. I think this movie brought bullying more to light. It has probably helped a lot of teenagers know how to better handle a situation like the one in the movie.

Rachel McAdams' performance as Regina George  was fantastic and perfectly (and somewhat exaggerated lol) captured the typical teen 
mean girl
I agree. The ratings speak for all of the actors. It sounds like it was a fun movie to work on with a great group of actors.
It also helped teenagers know how not to handle a bully situation!
Yes! And to understand that they are not alone. For a movie to be made about it, others have experienced it as well.
Overall, it is a great movie
